stem: Select the correct insulin types to complete the client's discharge teaching regarding peak times.
template: The client is instructed that {{insulin1}} has a peak effect 2â€“4 hours after administration, whereas {{insulin2}} is peakless and provides steady control over 24 hours.

rationale.correct: Regular insulin (Short-acting) peaks in 2-4 hours. Glargine (Long-acting) is peakless. Rapid-acting (Lispro/Aspart) peaks in 30-90 minutes.
rationale.incorrect: NPH is intermediate and peaks in 4-12 hours.
clinicalPearls: Always check BG before peak times to monitor for hypoglycemia.
